articles.title: Why the Drop in India's Labour Participation Rate Can't Be Ignored by Policymakers - The Wire
articles.description: As per independent economic data agency CMIE, India’s LPR was 41.38% in March 2021, but has further fallen to 40.15 % last month.
articles.content: Even as national output has crept back to pre-pandemic levels, what remains an enduring puzzle is the dramatic fall in Indias employment rate to an all time low of around 42% lately. This is by far t… [+5097 chars]

articles.title: Why Sebi’s algo trading proposals worry brokers and fintechs - Mint
articles.description: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has issued a discussion paper on regulating algorithmic trading, or trades generated out of automatic execution and logic. Mint examines why the paper has spooked fintech players and brokerages.
